title: 104_hr3665
content: The "Census of Agriculture Act of 1996" is the short title for this Act. It transfers the authority to conduct the Census of Agriculture to the Secretary of Agriculture. The "Census of Agriculture Act of 1996" transfers the authority to conduct the Census of Agriculture to the Secretary of Agriculture. The Secretary is required to take a census of agriculture in 1998 and every 5th year thereafter, collecting data from the previous year. Failure to answer census questions truthfully may result in penalties under the United States Code. The Census of Agriculture Act of 1996 transfers the authority to conduct the Census of Agriculture to the Secretary of Agriculture. Each census under this subsection shall include each State, the District of Columbia, and other areas under US jurisdiction. The Secretary of Commerce may provide information collected under title 13, US Code, to the Secretary of Agriculture for statistical purposes only. The Secretary of Agriculture is required to provide information collected in a census to the Secretary of Commerce for statistical purposes only. Rules and regulations for this subsection may be prescribed by the respective Secretaries. Section 343(a)(11)(F) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include reference to section 526(c) of the Revised Statutes. SEC. 3. PROVISIONS RELATING TO CONFIDENTIALITY OF INFORMATION. (a) Information Furnished to the Department of Agriculture and Commerce includes amendments to sections of the Food Security Act of 1985 and the Revised Statutes regarding the authority to furnish information and confidentiality of information. The curr_chunk states that information provided for sections 9 and 214 of title 13, United States Code, should be considered as if it were furnished under the same provisions. The House of Representatives passed the legislation on July 22, 1996.
